page.title: 15FARMS-DUNTON GREEN/CHEVENING
page.content: Most of the area has{mixed}farming on the gault clay of the Vale of Holmesdale. Farms are mainly privately owned but some are tenanted (Chevening Estate). The most common size of farms is between 60 & 100 acres.Fields vary in size from 4-15 acres.Wire fences are replacing hedges. {Livestock}include:Friesian dairy herds, mixed breed store cattle, crossbred Kent-Border Leicester and Suffolk. A few farms have some pigs kept in enclosed sheds. {Cereals}include:wheat,barley and oats mainly used for animal feed. Over recent years the acreage of cereals has changed with market prices and subsidies. The area is just west of the Kent hop growing region. Orchards are small & less common than to the east.
